name: Gunung Mulu National Park (Mulu Caves)
features: UNESCO World Heritage Site with limestone karst formations and the world's largest cave chamber.
address: Gunung Mulu National Park, Miri, Sarawak

name: Niah National Park (Niah Caves)
features: Prehistoric cave paintings and archaeological finds dating back 40,000 years.

name: Lambir Hills National Park
features: Rich biodiversity, scenic waterfalls, and nature hiking trails.

name: Canada Hill and the Grand Old Lady
features: Malaysia’s first oil well and scenic lookout point over Miri.

name: Coco Cabana
features: Seaside venue with lighthouse, art installations, and waterfront events.

name: Miri City Fan
features: Urban park with gardens, a swimming pool, and cultural hall.

name: Tusan Beach
features: Natural beach famous for glowing 'Blue Tears' and cliff formations.

name: Taman Awam Miri
features: Public park with a suspension bridge, gardens, and playgrounds.

name: Tua Pek Kong Temple
features: Oldest temple in Miri with intricate Chinese architectural design.

name: Miri Handicraft Centre
features: Traditional Sarawakian crafts, beadwork, and souvenir shopping.

name: Tamu Muhibbah
features: Bustling traditional market selling produce and local goods.

name: Tanjong Lobang Beach
features: Popular beach spot for scenic views and sunsets.

name: Miri Times Square
features: Modern seaside destination for shopping and dining.

name: Miri Crocodile Farm
features: Home to hundreds of crocodiles and exotic animals with exhibits.

name: San Ching Tian Temple
features: One of Southeast Asia’s largest Taoist temples with colorful statues.
